alert.note: Alert for Carroll; Whiteside (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued August 08 at 3:50AM CDT until August 09 at 4:00PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of northwest Illinois and Iowa, including the following counties, in northwest Illinois, Carroll, Jo Daviess, Stephenson and Whiteside. In Iowa, Benton, Buchanan, Clinton, Delaware, Dubuque, Jackson, Jones and Linn. * WHEN...Until 7 AM CDT this morning. * IMPACTS...Passing thunderstorms with rainfall rates of 1 to 2 inches per hour may result in flash flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - More rain over saturated ground will bring the risk of additional flash flooding.
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
